intro: Miconia phaeotricha, commonly known as the dark-haired miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves and showy, violet-pink bracts that surround its small white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
